runs.comm: starts with a wide, full and down the leg side
full, a bit of swing away from Guptill, punched back to the bowler
on the pads now, tucked away towards long leg, rolls at a slow enough pace for the keeper to run to his left to field it
full on middle and leg, driven carefully with a straight bat to the right of mid-on
fullish on off stump, pushed with soft hands towards mid-on
and there's the BMac special. Down the track, and boom, back over the bowler's head. That usual flat-bat swing, with the hips swivelling through the shot to generate even more power
full, swings in to middle and leg, and McCullum simply gets his front pad out of the way and punches it back with vicious power past the non-striker
length ball, angling away outside off, Guptill leaves it alone
a bit of width, maybe not short enough to cut, through him a touch too quick as he steps back and across to flay it through the off side
back of a length, closer to off stump, punched to short cover
another good-looking backfoot punch, straight to the fielder at cover
nice length, angling across, brings McCullum forward and he leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, another leave from Guptill
down the track, it's a slower full-toss outside off. Goes for the big smack over mid-off, can't connect

big appeal. Yorks McCullum as he comes down the track again, smacks him on the foot before he can jam his bat down. Bounces on the full, possibly, to the keeper, and do they think it's an edge, and it's caught behind? It hasn't hit the foot. It may have hit the outside edge after the bat hit the ground. Or the bat and then the ground. Or the ground and then the bat and then the ground. No way to tell, and it's not out.
very full on off stump, makes a bit of room to hit it through cover, gets a thick edge to the third man boundary
full on off stump, stays leg side of the ball to defend towards short cover

down the track comes McCullum, meets it on the full, and nearly pops a low catch to mid-off! It was angled in, he didn't have any room, and it hit close to the bottom of the bat, and it just dropped short of the diving fielder
this one's just about in his slot, and he clears his front leg to launch it back over the bowler's head
lovely straight drive! Not all that bad a ball from Shapoor as he pitched the ball up on off stump and searched for swing, not much there for him and Guptill pressed forward and just punched it
that time it was a poor ball and Guptill climbed on it with a cut. Raced to the man at cover, who had to move a couple of steps to his right but he only just about reaches it
short and wide, Baz sits back and flat-bats it over extra cover. No intention to keep it down and backed himself to clear mid-off.

full and a shade outside off, drilled to cover for a single with the fielder on the edge of the circle. Sends down a throw that hits direct and wanders away to the long leg boundary. Guptill was well home, shouldn't have shied
stands up tall behind a shortish delivery on off stump and punched it in front of point, but cover rushes to his left and dives to make an excellent stop
another back foot punch from Guptill and Najibullah at point moves quickly to his right and dives to keep it to a single
full and angled into the pads, Guptill deftly clips past mid-on's right
looks for the blockhole and almost finds it. Full enough that Baz can only get a single to mid-off
slipping into the pads and Guptill keeps to his crease to tickle it around the corner to long leg
low full toss, curls in at McCullum too, just about manages to flick it through square leg.
slower ball, right up there too. McCullum was almost beaten, had to reach outside his off stump to chop it towards point
full on off stump, Guptill looks to smack it through the covers but mistimes it. Hits the bottom of the bat, I think

top-edge! But it swirls away from short third man. Nabi had spotted his opposite number shaping for a reverse sweep and pushed the ball outside leg. Baz went through with the shot and almost paid for it
excellent work from Nabi again, saw the batsman coming down at him and pulled his pace back. Can only defend
round three goes to Brendon as he backs away against a flatter delivery and lashes it through cover point
that's a knockout! It's short, it sits up and Baz tonks it into the crowd at deep midwicket to bring up the fifth partnership

nope, this is the knockout! It's quicker, it's fuller and McCullum went for another pull. Poor choice of shot as he gets the bottom of the inside edge, deflects it onto his pads and then into the stumps
flighted on off stump, worked through midwicket
full toss outside off, eased with an angled blade to cover
excellent line from Shapoor, keeping it full and on fifth stump. Guptill acknowledges it with a leave
back of a length on off stump, blocked
just a shade shortish on off stump, defended under his eyes
good length on middle, Williamson though stays back and clips it to short midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off
fuller delivery, seems to straighten a touch as well, Guptill blocks towards point
back of a length and outside off, Guptill is caught between playing and leave and in the end the ball thuds onto the face of the bat and wanders to short third man
flash and miss from Guptill as the shortish delivery with a lot of width tempts him
a touch overpitched on off stump and Guptill leans forward and caresses it to cover
142kph, cramps him up by going wide of the crease and delivering a fast short ball. Guptill hops while trying to play a one-legged pull and wears it on the thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the covers
full on off stump, calmly driven to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Williamson punches to cover
shortish delivery seemed to hold on the pitch and Williamson's punch almost reached a diving Shapoor and his long right hand
shortish and outside off, run to point
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off with an open face
short on leg stump, Williamson pushes his weight back and pulls to long leg where Hamid fumbles and allows a second run
fullish, a bit of width outside off, and Guptill climbs into that flat-batted square drive, runs away very quickly to the point boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
shortish, extra bounce as Guptill goes back and across to defend, pops off his gloves towards backward point, but it dropped short of the fielder desperately rushing in
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short ball, sits up at waist height, and he pulls it away handsomely to the square leg boundary, front leg going up in a prance
shot! That's full outside off and he extends his arms, finishes with left elbow high, and holds his pose after lifting the ball smoothly over extra cover
back of a length, too much width, and he's back and across to carve that away through point
full outside off, and he takes a big back and across step before moving his front foot forward to drive that to the left of the diving short cover fielder
back of a length on off stump, he's moved across to off stump even before the bowler released, tucks it away to short midwicket
shuffles across again, works this back of a length ball from outside off through midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched towards mid-on and they decide to run the quick single
back of a length outside off, big step back and across, pokes it towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover, who fumbles to allow the single

appeal for lbw, I'm not sure that's not missing leg stump. Not given, they aren't reviewing. Big inside-edge too. Went on the back foot to defend, and it came back in a touch. Should have been forward to that length, maybe
back of a length outside off, jumps across to tuck it into the leg side
back of a length outside off, dabbed away behind point
short ball, jumps up to ride the bounce and defend towards short midwicket
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
shortish outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
tossed up on leg stump, defended to short midwicket
down the track, not quite to the pitch defended to point
flatter, angled into the pads, whipped away towards deep backward square leg
down the track, clips this from outside off down to long-on
short and wide, slapped hard but Nabi dives to his left at short cover to stop it
back of a length outside off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to Dawlat
full outside off, checked drive to short cover
shortish outside off, rises to his toes to punch to backward point
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
bouncer, Guptill ducks his left shoulder under it
full-toss on middle and off, punched down to long-on
tossed up outside off, driven to backward point
goes back to a length ball on middle and leg, tucks it away to short fine leg. That hurried onto him
back of a length, turns towards off stump, goes deep in his crease, punches to long-on
down the track, whipped to long-on
nice flight and dip on middle and leg, defended into the on side
stays back in his crease to a short of a length ball and pushes to point
keeps him pinned to his crease with a shortish ball on off stump, and Williamson is comfortably behind it

straying on the pads off the shortish ball and sets up for a pull. Barely seems like he's powered it, but it's a short boundary behind square leg and Williamson has done brilliantly to place it to the left of long leg

opens the face against a shortish delivery outside off and punches to point. Great work from Najibullah, diving to his left and pulling out a one-handed save to keep it to nothing. That was quite well timed too
too straight and Williamson gets in line to flick through to deep midwicket
beeauutiful inswinging yorker! All it needed was the stumps to be spread-eagled, but Guptill blocks it stubbornly. Terrific ball, terrific shot!
eases down the track to get the pitch of a tossed up delivery and lifts it over midwicket with such grace. Such serene strokeplay
eased into the covers with a good, strong front foot stride
a skip down the track to lift a good length ball over wide long-on
goes back to a shortish delivery outside off and taps it down to long-on
flatter and quicker on off stump, Guptill goes back to hit into the covers
nicely flighted on off stump and Guptill is forward with a drive to long-off
good length ball on off stump, met with a straight bat to mid-on
that's a top-notch delivery! Good length ball seemed to angle in, change its mind halfway through, hit the deck and veer away from the on-the-up drive from Guptill. Magnificent to watch
back of a length on off stump, drilled past a diving Shenwari to the right of short cover
gets up off his toes to generate his timing for a punch through the covers. Again the placement is striking as he beats cover to his left
banged in short, a bit too much so, as it soars over Guptill's head
mistimed pull over midwicket. It's a shortish delivery, seemed to rise up on Guptill as he goes for his shot and lobs over the ring
full on off stump, presents a straight bat down on it and the big boot of Dawlat (or is it Shapoor's) comes in handy
fullish on off stump, Guptill is confidently forward to push to long-off
fullish on off stump, seems to straighten at the last minute as well, but Williamson covers it and runs it down to third man
stands up tall behind a shortish ball and smacks it through the covers. Pulled his front leg off the pitch to help him time the stroke better

picked out midwicket! Shapoor was brought back for this express reason and he has managed to lure a false stroke out. Williamson has been in such good form that he jumps into a pull too soon and miscues it. Minor opening found. Can Afghanistan break through?
play and miss first ball, and he kicks the turf. Fuller delivery to invite the drive and out it comes. Only the the ball cuts away after pitching
keeps it up there and outside off, Taylor drive to mid-off
clears short midwicket and collects a boundary off a pull. Seemed quite similar to the Williamson dismissal, only Guptill has a few inches in height on Williamson and uses it to his advantage
goes back to a shortish ball outside off and punches to point
keeps him in his crease with a back of a length ball on middle
shortish delivery on middle, tucked into the leg side for a single
slower ball, and it's a full toss too. Taylor wafts a drive and misses. Talk about being out of form
fuller delivery outside off, Taylor gets tighter and leaves
full outside off, driven to long-off
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended into the covers
low full-toss outside off, goes for the drive through cover, bottom hand takes over, drags it to short midwicket
attempted slower ball, ends up as a full-toss outside off, comes forward to play a checked drive through cover
shortish outside off, angling in, chopped away to third man
length ball, angled across towards off stump, pushed gently down the ground to mid-off, easy single
tossed up on off stump, gets it to dip and turn into middle stump, defended carefully into the on side
a little fuller and Guptill drives to long-on
full on middle and leg, clipped to backward square leg
tossed up on off stump, defended with the turn to short midwicket
down the track now, reaches the pitch of this ball dangled up on off stump, whips it to long-on
length ball outside off, dabs it square on the off side and they hurry through for the single as Zazai scurries to the ball from behind the stumps
back of a length on off stump, punched away to the left of short cover
low full-toss on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, angling in, gets on his toes to bunt it into the leg side
full outside off, driven to the right of point
fullish, angling in towards off stump, defends to mid-on
full-toss on off stump, whipped to the left of short midwicket, who makes a diving stop
turns down the leg side, and he goes on the back foot to work it to short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on, dabs it to short third man
back of a length, turns into middle stump, defended to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra cover
length ball on middle stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
full, angling down leg, must have tickled the pad through to the keeper as he tries to flick, because the umpire didn't signal wide
fullish, angling into Guptill's hitting zone, clears his front leg and brings a straight bat through a lovely arc to loft it over wide mid-on
back of a length, angling down the leg side, Guptill can't make contact with the flick. Dawlat thinks there's some pad on this, asks for a review as he walks past the umpire
length ball outside off, a bit of shape in. Guptill leaves it alone
a bit fuller now, shapes into the batsman and he presses forward to block into the off side
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
floaty full-toss on off stump, was the slower ball. He saw it a bit late, jammed his bat down, and the edge ran down to third man to enable him to bring up his 22nd ODI fifty
tossed up, drops down on a full length on middle stump, flicked away to deep square leg
down the track and Nabi holds it back a bit, outside off, stretches out his front pad to defend towards the bowler
full on off stump, driven to long-on
full on middle stump, looks for the drive to long-on, short midwicket gets in the way
a touch shorter and he goes on the back foot to work it away to the right of short midwicket
back of a length outside off, opens his face and steers it to short third man
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of short cover

shot! That is gorgeous, you can watch the replay all day. Takes a couple of steps down the track, gets inside the line, and simply punches with a vertical bat and extends his arms a little extra to send that soaring over the bowler's head
back of a length now, goes back to defend, comes into him and hits him on the thigh pad

Oh man. There was no single there. Back of a length outside off, punched to the right of point and they take on the fielder's arm after a moment's hesitation. The throw to the bowler's end misses but the fielder backing up from mid-on, Shenwari, rebounds it into the stumps and Guptill is a couple of inches short of his crease
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, goes back and across to defend
full, a bit of swing in towards off stump, was that reverse? Clipped away to long leg
very full outside off, blocked to short cover
length ball outside off, opens his bat face to guide it to the left of Shapoor at third man. Bends down to pick up the ball and ends up pushing it away a few feet
length ball angling in, a bit quicker this one, and he can only block towards point. Was looking for that late dab again
back of a length outside off, straightens a touch. Elliott pokes at it with half a bat, doesn't make contact
full on off stump, punched to mid-off
yorker on middle stump, jabbed down the ground towards mid-on
full outside off, and suddenly the Ross Taylor we all know and love reappears. Steps forward and flows into an on-the-up drive through square cover
back of a length on off stump, tucked away through square leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full-toss outside off, pushed away through cover point
full on leg stump, clipped towards square leg
full and wide, driven with a full follow through, bat finishing over left shoulder, to the left of sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
shortish outside off, goes for the cut, can't make contact
fullish on off stump, punched to mid-off
shortish, angling in towards off stump, Elliott swivels to pull it away to the left of deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, and he stabs it away towards third man
shortish outside off, chopped to third man
full on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
down the track, reaches the pitch to whip it away to the right of short midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, goes on the back foot to defend towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off, clipped to long-on
fired into the pads, comes forward and flicks it in the air into the vacant square leg region
full on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
fullish outside off, slapped away to deep point with a flourishing follow-through
shortish outside off, slapped away to the right of third man
full and wide, slices his drive in the air but wide of backward point diving to his left
shuffles across outside off before Shapoor is in his delivery stride, defends this length ball towards short cover
short and wide, carved away towards third man
shortish outside off, doesn't quite come on, Taylor chops it away to point
full on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
drifts onto leg stump, and Elliott goes down on one knee to sweep it away to the backward square leg boundary
tossed up a bit slower on middle stump, presses forward to block to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, and he rocks back quickly to cut it away into the gap to the left of backward point
flighted ball on off and middle, defended with the turn to short midwicket
a bit of dip now on an off-stump line, he was looking to come forward to that, adjusted, pulled his front foot back, and defended it back to the bowler
shortish outside off, slapped towards point
length ball angling into off stump, defended to short cover
a bit of width, not too short, Taylor cuts it hard into the ground and it bounces over the leaping backward point fielder, who gets a hand to it to slow it down
shuffles across a long way to this full ball outside off, defends it back to the bowler

Is that another run-out? Full outside off, driven to mid-off, and the fielder, Nabi, hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end, and, as replays confirm, Elliott is short of his crease. He hit it too firmly for that to be a comfortable single. OUT, says the big screen.
full outside off, jabbed to short cover
tossed up on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
flatter now, a bit round-arm, angling in towards middle stump, defended into the on side
shortish, a bit of width, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
length ball turning towards middle stump. Taylor jams his bat down to defend, goes off the inside edge into the leg side
full on off stump, whipped to short midwicket
short outside off, cut away towards deep point
full-toss on leg stump, blocked to short midwicket
low full-toss outside off, driven to sweeper cover
yorker on off stump, poked back to the bowler
fullish outside off, doesn't quite come on. Wants to drive through cover initially, adjusts and uses his wrists to tuck it into the leg side, towards short midwicket
full, down the leg side, poor ball, glanced away to the left of the diving wicketkeeper
bouncer outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, and that is that. Anderson stretches out and swipes it away powerfully through midwicket
